text: goal saniabidjan provide survey data behavior practices managing sanitation facilties two low-income areas Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire.

title: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire
text: package provides access one dataset saniabidjan. contains household survey data two low-income areas Abidjan. focus survey understand behavior practices population terms managing sanitation facilities, well assess diseases face.

title: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire
text: dataset saniabidjan contains data household surveys cover 101 households Abobo 106 households Yopougon. 207 observations 25 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire
code: library(saniabidjan) library(ggplot2) # Provide some example code here saniabidjan |>   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = facilities_type)) +    geom_bar(aes(fill = lat_care), position = "dodge") +   labs(title = "Distribution of latrine care for different latrine types",         x = "Type of facilities",        fill = "Latrine care type")

what: saniabidjan: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire — saniabidjan
title: saniabidjan: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire — saniabidjan
text: Household survey data collected Yopougon Abobo Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire. survey practices related management sanitation facilities, specifically, latrines tanks.

title: saniabidjan: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire — saniabidjan
saniabidjan: Data About Behavior and Practices of Managing Sanitation Facilties in Abidjan, Cote d’Ivoire — saniabidjan
text: tibble 207 rows 25 variables area_name Identify survey areas, options including (1) Abobo (2) Yopougon. sex Indicates respondents gender, options including (1) female (2) male. education Level education respondents, options including (1) , (2) primary, (3) coranic, (4) high school, (5) graduate. housing_type Description accommodation unit respondent lives, options including (1) common courtyard (2) individual. status Indicates respondent homeowner , options including (1) free host, (2) owner, (3) renter. lat_facilities Ensuring presence absence latrine facilities facilities_loc Specifies exact location latrine household, options including (1) house, (2) yard, (3) yard. facilities_type Describes type latrine used household, options including (1) pit latrine, (2) improved latrine, (3) public latrine. lat_sharing Explains latrines used household nb_user Reveals number users latrines. impacts_of_sharing Indication respondent perceives use latrines, options including (1) hygiene problems, (2) problems, (3) vulnerable disease, (4) waiting line. lat_care Gives overview people charge latrine cleaning, options including (1) , (2) care, (3) private person, (4) round turn. clean_freq_wk Specifies cleaning frequency latrines household. tank_presence Ensuring presence absence septic tank household tank_location Specifies exact location septic tank household, options including (1) court yard, (2) court yard, (3) know. latrines_nb Reveals number latrines connecting septic tank. tk_status Expresses septic tank performance status. empty_freq_yr Indicates emptying frequency septic tank household, options including (1) 1, (2) 2 (3) 3. empty_mode Indicates septic tank emptied household, options including (1) emptying truck, (2) manual emptying, (3) truck manual. empty_price Shows charge emptying septic tank. wastwat_dispos Show whether household wastewater disposal facilities, options including (1) courtyard, (2) open drain, (3) street. waste_cont Identify whether household solid waste disposal facilities. waste_cont_loc Precise location solid waste disposal equipment, options including (1) courtyard (2) courtyard. cont_empty_wk Indicates emptying frequency solid waste disposal equipment common_ill Overview common disease household associated sanitation, options including (1) diarrhea, (2) infections, (3) malaria, (4) typhoid fever.
